quantityRules.description: Mourning geckos MUST be housed in groups of at least 2 (they are naturally social). Minimum 12Ã—12Ã—18 inches comfortably houses up to 4 geckos. Add approximately 5 gallons per additional 2 geckos.

careTargets.gradient: Vertical temperature gradient with warmth at top near heat lamp and cooler areas toward bottom

temperament: Flighty and not handleable - display animals only
originRegion: South Pacific islands, Central/South America, Hawaii (tropical rainforest)
setupTips: Maximize vertical climbing space with vines, branches, and foliage at all levels
Use magnetic feeding ledges for crested gecko diet placement
Keep basking area low (80-85Â°F) - use 25w bulb with dimmer to fine-tune
Add layer of leaf litter over substrate for naturalistic appearance and foraging enrichment
notes: ALL mourning geckos are female - reproduce via parthenogenesis (no males exist)
Offspring are genetic clones of their mother
Males were documented once in 1960s Vietnam - so rare they're considered extinct, making mourning geckos only known self-sustaining all-female vertebrate species
'Mourning' name comes from soft chirping vocalizations that sound like mournful crying - used for territory defense and social communication
Climb on glass/smooth surfaces using microscopic hair-like setae (500,000 per foot) - each hair creates weak molecular attraction allowing vertical climbing

warnings.message: Never house individually - mourning geckos are social and REQUIRE companions (minimum 2 geckos). Single housing causes stress and behavioral issues.
Temperatures consistently above 85Â°F can be LETHAL. Keep basking area at 80-85Â°F maximum and use a dimmer to prevent overheating.
Temperatures at or below 72Â°F for extended periods can cause illness. Ensure proper heating gradient.
Not handleable due to tiny size (4 inches) and flighty nature. These are observation pets, not interactive pets.
Use tap or spring water (NOT distilled) for misting - distilled water lacks essential minerals and can cause deficiencies.
All offspring will be female and identical to mother - plan for population growth and eventual enclosure upgrades.

feedingRequirements: Omnivorous - primary diet is commercial crested gecko diet (CGD powder mixed with water)
Best CGD brands: Pangea, Repashy, Black Panther Zoological, Gecko Pro, Leapin' Leachie, Zoo Med
Live insects offered 1-2x weekly for enrichment and protein diversity
Best insects: crickets, dubia roaches, red runner roaches, darkling beetles, snails, grasshoppers
Insects must be appropriately sized (no larger than space between gecko's eyes)
Dust insects with calcium supplement without D3 (Arcadia CalciumPro Mg, MinerAll Outdoor, or Repashy SuperCal NoD)
Skipping one CGD feeding per week is not harmful and may be beneficial
feedingSchedule: Provide crested gecko diet (CGD) continuously - replace every 24-48 hours
Offer calcium-dusted insects 1-2x per week for variety
Remove uneaten insects after feeding session to prevent stress
Skip one CGD feeding per week if desired (natural fasting period)
Breeding females may eat more frequently - monitor body condition
waterNotes: Do NOT provide standing water dish (drowning risk for tiny geckos)
Primary hydration from misting - lick water droplets from leaves and surfaces
Mist enclosure every morning and evening with pump-style pressure sprayer
Use tap or spring water (NOT distilled/RO water) to provide essential minerals
mistingNotes: Mist twice daily - morning and evening (essential for hydration)
Humidity naturally rises at night and falls during day (this is healthy)
Humidity should be lower near basking area, higher in cool zone
Use pump-style pressure sprayer for fine mist coverage
Ensure adequate ventilation between mistings to prevent mold growth
substrateRecommendations: Use moisture-retentive naturalistic substrate (2-4 inches deep)
Best options: DIY tropical mix (60% organic topsoil + 40% coconut fiber), Lugarti Natural Reptile Bedding, Zoo Med Reptisoil, The Bio Dude Terra Fauna
Add generous layer of leaf litter on top for naturalistic appearance
Substrate helps stabilize humidity and cushions falls from climbing
Spot clean feces/urates daily, scoop contaminated substrate as needed
Complete substrate replacement every 1-3 months (or go bioactive for less maintenance)
handlingGuidance: DO NOT HANDLE - mourning geckos are too small (4 inches) and flighty
Handling causes extreme stress and injury risk
These are display/observation animals, not interactive pets
Enjoy watching natural behaviors instead of hands-on interaction
If you need to move a gecko, gently guide into small container rather than grabbing
